record.description: One of the first to visit the Zero Gradient Synchrotron (ZGS) at Argonne National Laboratory after it achieved its full operating power of 12.5 billion electron volts was Illinois Governor Otto G. Kerner. Governor Kerner was one of the principle speakers September 26 at a Nuclear Applications Conference held at Argonne. During the visit Dr. Roger Hildebrand (right), Associate Laboratory Director for High Energy Physics, explained the operation of the ZGS to Governor Kerner. With them is Dr. Lee C. Teng, Director of Argonne's Particle Accelerator Division. Behind them is a portion of the 4,800-ton magnet ring that guides protons around the ZGS as they are accelerated.
